title: Unknown bold font.
content:
I'd like to use this font on my website, but so far I have yet to be able to identify it. Nothing I have in my collection of fonts looks even close. I've marked the font in particular that I want identified.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023041725/http:/typophile.com/files/Font_38.jpg) | 315.36 KB |
author: BelziBhaal

comments.content:
This comes up every few weeks. The "font" is internal to the printer and does not necessarily match a font that you could use on your website.  
That having been said, you might be happy with a web-font semi-bold version of [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023041725/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/proxima-nova/%3Cbr%20/%3E) by Mark Simonson, which has essentially the same letter forms and numbers. The only obvious difference is the lack of a serif at the base of 1. If you are really observant you will find that the upper tip of 6 dips slightly more an the printer font.  
Don
I think it looks a lot like Tahoma and not like Proxima Nova at all.
